meanings.definition: Covered with or resembling a shell
meanings.sent1: The turtle had the shelliest back I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The hermit crab found the shelliest rock to hide under.
meanings.sent3: The snail felt proud of having the shelliest home on the block.
meanings.sent4: The old shipwreck was the shelliest thing on the ocean floor.
meanings.sent5: The shelliest seashell shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The beachcomber collected the shelliest treasures along the shore.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed the shelliest collection of marine life.
meanings.sent3: The crab parade featured the shelliest participants in town.
meanings.sent4: The shelliest crab in the bucket stood out from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The shelliest conch shell echoed the sound of the waves.

meanings.sent1: The shelliest areas of the beach were where the hermit crabs gathered.
meanings.sent2: The shelliest creatures in the ocean are often the most protected.
meanings.sent3: The shelliest spots in the forest were home to the elusive snails.
meanings.sent4: The shelliest corners of the garden attracted the most insects.
meanings.sent5: The shelliest shells were found near the rocky cliffs.
